If you are looking for an option to get trip with the cultural, religious as well as historical memorable experience of India, visit to Gujarat can be the best option for you. This amazing piece of land is considered as the Jewel of West. The cultural and extraordinary traditions of Gujarat are originated since the time of Indus valley civilization. 
Gujarat, India's westernmost state has varied terrain and numerous sacred sites. In its urban center of Ahmedabad is the Calico Museum of Textiles, displaying antique and modern Indian fabrics. Spiritual leader Mahatma Gandhiâ€™s base from 1917-1930 was Sabarmati Ashram, where his living quarters remain on view. The Jama Masjid (Friday Mosque), built in the 15th-century, is defined by its courtyard and columned design. The land of Gujarat is also listed under some of the top tourist destinations of India. Therefore, it attracts a large number of visitors every year. The state is also famous for its beaches and longest sea coastline. 
You will be able to find many well-known beaches in Gujarat that include Beyt Dwarka Beach, Ahmedpur Mandavi, Gopnath Beach, Chorwad Beach as well as Veraval Beach. Apart from the beautiful beaches and landscapes, Gujarat is also blessed with many holy temples and places, architectural assets, wildlife sanctuary, hill resorts as well as many other interesting places. The visitors of Gujarat can also experience a wide range of elegant and stylish handicrafts, yummy foodstuffs, and wide-ranging destinations. The colorful lifestyle of the Guajarati people will also make your trip as an unforgettable one. The charm of Gujarat never fails to attract the attention of tourists. 
The fascinating wildlife of Gujarat is one of the main reasons for the increasing number of tourists to this place. Each has its unique environment and related to each other in one or the other way. The Gujarat wildlife is also the habitat of different types of animals. You can also find some of the extremely rare animals in the wildlife area of Gujarat. The Gir forest of Gujarat is world famous. Asiatic lion is only seen in the Gir forest. 
When you are visiting the wild life of Gujarat, you will also come across many national parks as well as wildlife sanctuary. Some of the well known wildlife of Gujarat includes Wild Ass Wildlife Sanctuary, Sasangir National Park, Marine National Park, Nalsarovar Bird Sanctuary as well as Velavadar Blackbuck Sanctuary.
